original: 'di ni de lta yin no //üîΩ'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba rig pa dang / cig shos kyi 'bras bu ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di ni de lta yin no // 'di ni de lta ma yin no zhes bya ba rig pa dang / cig shos kyi 'bras bu ma yin nam /
translated: This is not so.

original: des na ji ltar 'bras bus rnam par 'jog gi rig pas ma yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'bras bus rnam par 'jog gi rig pas ma yin /
translated: How then can it be established by the effect and not by awareness?

original: 'bras bus rnam par gnas pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bus rnam par gnas pa ni kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: That which is established by the effect exists conventionally,

original: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no valid cognition.

original: rig pa med par 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rig pa med par 'bras bur ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can there be an effect without awareness?

original: rang rig pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang rig pas rig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is known by reflexive awareness.

original: des na 'bras bu bzhin du don rig pa yang rang rig pa tsam nyid do //
analyzed: des na 'bras bu bzhin du don rig pa yang rang rig pa tsam nyid do //
translated: Therefore, just as the effect, so the awareness of the object is reflexive awareness itself.

original: des na don rig pa yang de nyid la yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
analyzed: des na don rig pa yang de nyid la yin no zhes rnam par gnas so //
translated: Therefore, the awareness of the object is just that.üîΩThus:

original: 'di ltar / don rig byed pa shes na ni //üîΩde yi de ma thag byung ba'i //
analyzed: 'di ltar / don rig byed pa shes na ni // de yi de ma thag byung ba'i //
translated: If one knows the awareness of the object,üîΩthen the effect that arises from that

original: 'bras bu de ni de lta bur //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ni de lta bur //
translated: is understood to be like that,

original: go byed gzhan du de ma yin //
analyzed: go byed gzhan du de ma yin //
translated: but not otherwise.

original: de'i phyir de'i gnod par byed pa ni 'di nyid de /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gnod par byed pa ni 'di nyid de /
translated: Therefore, this is its refutation:

original: rang bzhin gzhan 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin gzhan 'dzin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: that which apprehends a different nature.

original: de yang shes pa gzhan la ltos nas shes pa thams cad yin no //
analyzed: de yang shes pa gzhan la ltos nas shes pa thams cad yin no //
translated: Moreover, in relation to other cognitions, all cognitions are non-conceptual.

original: gal te sad pa'i shes pa'i don //
analyzed: gal te sad pa'i shes pa'i don //
translated: Moreover, all consciousnesses are consciousnesses in dependence on other consciousnesses.

original: mi slu ba can ma yin nam //
analyzed: mi slu ba can ma yin nam //
translated: Isn‚Äôt the object of a waking consciousness undeceiving?

original: de ji ltar na gzhan gyis de mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na gzhan gyis de mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: How could another consciousness apprehend it?

original: rmi lam du rtogs pa yang de las gzhan pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid yin pas de ji ltar gnod pa yin /
analyzed: rmi lam du rtogs pa yang de las gzhan pa'i rmi lam gyi shes pas 'dzin pa'i phyir mi slu ba nyid yin pas de ji ltar gnod pa yin /
translated: Since a consciousness in a dream also apprehends objects that are undeceiving because they are apprehended by other consciousnesses in that dream, how could it be harmed?

original: sad pa'i shes pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pas gnod pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is harmed by a waking consciousness.

original: sad pa'i shes pa la yang des gnod pa'i phyir de ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa la yang des gnod pa'i phyir de ni mtshungs so //
translated: That is similar to the case of a waking consciousness.

original: yid gnyid kyis nyams pa la de yod pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yid gnyid kyis nyams pa la de yod pa'i phyir gnod par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Because it exists for a mind impaired by sleep, it does not harm it.

original: dper na mig nyams pas skra shad la sogs par mthong ba de las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: dper na mig nyams pas skra shad la sogs par mthong ba de las bzlog pa la gnod par byed pa ma yin pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: For example, it is like the fact that the consciousnesses of those with impaired vision that see such things as falling hairs are not harmed by those with unimpaired vision.

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: gnyid kyis nyams par byed pa'i sems gang gis de ltar rtogs pa yin /
analyzed: gnyid kyis nyams par byed pa'i sems gang gis de ltar rtogs pa yin /
translated: By what mind impaired by sleep does one realize that?

original: @29b re zhig de yi gnas skabs su //
analyzed: @29b re zhig de yi gnas skabs su //
translated: For a while, in that state,

original: de ni de ltar rtogs pa yin //
analyzed: de ni de ltar rtogs pa yin //
translated: it is like that, it is understood.

original: gnyid log pa'am langs pa na rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gnyid log pa'am langs pa na rtogs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that it is understood when one is asleep or when one awakens,

original: 'di thams cad rmi lam na yang yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'di thams cad rmi lam na yang yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt all of this also present in a dream?üîΩIn this way:

original: 'di ltar // rmi lam na yang bdag nyid ni //
analyzed: 'di ltar // rmi lam na yang bdag nyid ni //
translated: In a dream, too, one thinks,

original: gnyid kyis log pa slar sang ces //
analyzed: gnyid kyis log pa slar sang ces //
translated: ‚ÄúI am asleep, I will wake up.‚Äù

original: khyed kyis rnam dbyer brjod pa yi ;
analyzed: khyed kyis rnam dbyer brjod pa yi ;
translated: You say that there is a distinction,

original: ; rtogs pa 'di ni gang gis byas //
analyzed: ; rtogs pa 'di ni gang gis byas //
translated: but who makes this distinction?

original: sad pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni rmi lam du yang mthong ste nges na sad pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad de yang mtshan nyid ma yin par mthong bas yid ches par byed pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: sad pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad ni rmi lam du yang mthong ste nges na sad pa la sogs pa'i tha snyad de yang mtshan nyid ma yin par mthong bas yid ches par byed pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: The conventions of waking up and so on are seen even in a dream. If it is certain, then how could the conventions of waking up and so on be seen to be unreal and thus be established?

original: ci ste yid ches pas rig pa'i phyir de ltar yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste yid ches pas rig pa'i phyir de ltar yin no zhe na /
translated: But if it is so because it is known through belief,

original: rmi lam du yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni mtshungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam du yang de ltar 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di ni mtshungs so //
translated: then this is similar because it would be like that even in a dream.

original: ci ste rmi lam du yang 'di ni rmi lam mo zhes res 'ga' yid ches pa yod pa de'i phyir lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rmi lam du yang 'di ni rmi lam mo zhes res 'ga' yid ches pa yod pa de'i phyir lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you say that sometimes there is a belief in a dream that this is a dream, therefore it is not non-existent,

original: ci 'di bden pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa med dam /
analyzed: ci 'di bden pa yin no zhes bya bar rtogs pa med dam /
translated: then why is there no understanding that this is true?

original: des na bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it would be true.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rmi lam ni rnam par mi gnas pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rmi lam ni rnam par mi gnas pa yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, a dream is non-enduring.

original: 'di yang rnam par mi gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'di yang rnam par mi gnas pa nyid de /
translated: But this is also non-enduring,

original: phyug po la sogs pa rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyug po la sogs pa rnam par mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the rich, etc. are non-enduring.

original: der rnam par mi gnas pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin la rmi lam gyi ni rgyu med pa yin te /
analyzed: der rnam par mi gnas pa ni rgyu dang bcas pa yin la rmi lam gyi ni rgyu med pa yin te /
translated: What is non-enduring there has a cause, but a dream has no cause.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar // rmi lam du mthong ba ni mod la 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar // rmi lam du mthong ba ni mod la 'jig pa yin no zhe na /
translated: what is seen in a dream is destroyed immediately.

original: 'di ni bag chags brtan pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bag chags brtan pa yin gyi /
translated: This is a stable latent impression,

original: de ltar don sgrub par nus pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar don sgrub par nus pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not able to accomplish the object in that way.üîΩThus,

original: 'di ltar / der yang yid 'ong stsogs mthong ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / der yang yid 'ong stsogs mthong ba //
translated: there is the seeing of the pleasant, etc.

original: mod la 'jig par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: mod la 'jig par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: which is destroyed immediately.

original: rmi lam du yang nyin la ni //
analyzed: rmi lam du yang nyin la ni //
translated: Even in a dream,

original: rgyun mi 'chad par de mthong nyid //üîΩgal te rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa'i shes pa gnyis tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'am /
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par de mthong nyid // gal te rmi lam dang rmi lam ma yin pa'i shes pa gnyis tha dad par sgrub par byed pa'i tshad ma'am /
translated: It is seen just as it is, without interruption.üîΩIf you prove that the consciousness of a dream and the consciousness of the non-dream are different, there are two alternatives.

original: tshad ma ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
analyzed: tshad ma ma yin zhes rnam par rtog pa gnyis so //
translated: Either it is a valid cognition or it is not a valid cognition.

original: gal te tshad ma yin na de'i tshe de dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyis ma nges so //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yin na de'i tshe de dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir de nyid kyis ma nges so //
translated: If it is a valid cognition, then it has an object, and therefore it is not indeterminate.

original: ci ste tshad ma ma yin na /
analyzed: ci ste tshad ma ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not a valid cognition,üîΩthen the reason and the example are not established, so how can there be an inference? And how can the non-existence of the object be established?

original: de'i tshe phyogs dang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa 'jug cing dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na de ni ma yin te tshad ma nyid yin pas skyon med do //
analyzed: de'i tshe phyogs dang dpe ma grub pa'i phyir ji ltar rjes su dpag pa 'jug cing dmigs pa med pa nyid ji ltar 'grub ce na de ni ma yin te tshad ma nyid yin pas skyon med do //
translated: This is not so, because there is no fault, since it is a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: tshad ma thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Not all valid cognitions have objects,

original: rjes su dpag pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa la dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because inference does not have an object.

original: dmigs pa med kyang tha snyad kyi mi slu ba la ltos nas 'dir tshad @30a * //üîΩma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa med kyang tha snyad kyi mi slu ba la ltos nas 'dir tshad @30a * //üîΩma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it does not have an object, it is a valid cognition in regard to the non-deceptive conventional.

original: gal te rmi lam dang gzhan pa'i shes pa de gnyis tha dad par grub pa de lta na yang de sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te rmi lam dang gzhan pa'i shes pa de gnyis tha dad par grub pa de lta na yang de sgrub par byed pa'i shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir thams cad dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du thal ba ma yin no //
translated: If the two consciousnesses, the dream consciousness and the other consciousness, are established as different, then, because the consciousness that establishes them has an object, it is not the case that everything has an object.

original: de nyid tha dad sgrub byed ni //
analyzed: de nyid tha dad sgrub byed ni //
translated: The proof of their difference

original: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa nyid //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yi rtogs pa nyid //
translated: is just the understanding of the world.

original: bsgrub bya dpe yi dpyad pa 'di //
analyzed: bsgrub bya dpe yi dpyad pa 'di //
translated: This analysis of the example

original: snang ba la ni rten phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba la ni rten phyir ro //
translated: in the proof is based on appearance.

original: re zhig 'di ni rmi lam gyi shes pa yin la 'di ni sad pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten na rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: re zhig 'di ni rmi lam gyi shes pa yin la 'di ni sad pa'i shes pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni 'jig rten na rtogs pa yin no //
translated: First, the understanding in the world is that this is a dream consciousness and that is a waking consciousness.

original: de'i phyir de la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i tha snyad yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la brten nas bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub par byed pa'i tha snyad yin no //
translated: Therefore, based on that, the conventions of the probandum and the means of probandum are established.

original: de nas phyis gal te rnam par dpyod na 'di la rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu cung zad kyang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: de nas phyis gal te rnam par dpyod na 'di la rnam par dbye ba'i rgyu cung zad kyang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par sgrub par byed do //
translated: Later, if one analyzes, one establishes that they are not different because one does not perceive the slightest cause for their differentiation.

original: de lta yin na gzhan la nyis pa ci yod gal te nyes pa yod na /
analyzed: de lta yin na gzhan la nyis pa ci yod gal te nyes pa yod na /
translated: If that is so, what is wrong with that?

original: de lta yin na rig byed tshad mar sgrub pa la yang nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na rig byed tshad mar sgrub pa la yang nyes par 'gyur ro //

original: 'di ltar rig byed ni chos chan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rig byed ni chos chan yin no //
translated: In this way, the Vedas are a great Dharma.

original: de ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i tshig las tha dad ces brgal zhing brtags na ji skad brjod par bya //
analyzed: de ji ltar 'jig rten pa'i tshig las tha dad ces brgal zhing brtags na ji skad brjod par bya //
translated: When it is argued and examined, ‚ÄúHow is it different from worldly speech?‚Äù how can it be said?

original: gal te tshad ma med na 'jig rten pa'i tshig dang 'dra ba'i phyir ji ltar de 'jig rten pa'i tshig las tha dad pa'i chos can yin /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma med na 'jig rten pa'i tshig dang 'dra ba'i phyir ji ltar de 'jig rten pa'i tshig las tha dad pa'i chos can yin /
translated: If there is no valid cognition, then because it is similar to worldly speech, how is it that it is a phenomenon that is different from worldly speech?

original: 'on te tha dad pa nyid tshad mas grub par brjod na /
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa nyid tshad mas grub par brjod na /
translated: But if it is said that the difference is established by valid cognition,

original: de lta na sgrub par byed pa dgod pa la 'bras bu ci zhig yod //
analyzed: de lta na sgrub par byed pa dgod pa la 'bras bu ci zhig yod //
translated: then what is the point of setting forth a proof?

original: de'i phyir rtsod pa 'di ji ltar spang bar bya /
analyzed: de'i phyir rtsod pa 'di ji ltar spang bar bya /
translated: Therefore, how can this dispute be avoided?

original: gal te dbyangs dang yi ge'i go rims khyad par gzhan nyid las rig byed kyi tshogs tha dad par grub bo zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te dbyangs dang yi ge'i go rims khyad par gzhan nyid las rig byed kyi tshogs tha dad par grub bo zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is said that the collection of Vedas is established as different from other differences in the order of syllables and words, no.

original: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du phan tshun tha dad par grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de bzhin du phan tshun tha dad par grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and so too are the others, because they are established as mutually distinct.

original: 'on te rgyu 'di yod pa yin na /üîΩci 'di rig byed yin nam /
analyzed: 'on te rgyu 'di yod pa yin na / ci 'di rig byed yin nam /
translated: But if this cause exists,üîΩis it a Vedic injunction or not?

original: 'on te ma yin zhes dpyad pa na /
analyzed: 'on te ma yin zhes dpyad pa na /
translated: When it is analyzed,

original: gal te tshad ma yin na ni rig byed nyid do //
analyzed: gal te tshad ma yin na ni rig byed nyid do //
translated: if it is a valid cognition, then it is a Vedic injunction.

original: de ste de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de ste de lta ma yin na /
translated: But if it is not that,

original: 'dis dgos pa med pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'dis dgos pa med pa'i phyir spang bar bya ba yin no zhe na /
translated: then it should be rejected because it is purposeless.

original: de lta na ni 'o na 'dir //
analyzed: de lta na ni 'o na 'dir //
translated: In that case,

original: ro yang de ltar shes pa ni //
analyzed: ro yang de ltar shes pa ni //
translated: the taste of this should be understood

original: re zhig mtshungs par mthong ba yin //
analyzed: re zhig mtshungs par mthong ba yin //
translated: to be the same as what is seen in the following.

original: rmi lam grub pa 'di las ci //
analyzed: rmi lam grub pa 'di las ci //
translated: What is accomplished in a dream?

original: gzhan na min zhes rtog pa na /
analyzed: gzhan na min zhes rtog pa na /
translated: When it is thought, ‚ÄúIt is not elsewhere,‚Äù

original: dam par ji ltar 'gyur yin pa //
analyzed: dam par ji ltar 'gyur yin pa //
translated: how could it be supreme?

original: de ltar blta'o zhes bya yang //
analyzed: de ltar blta'o zhes bya yang //
translated: Even if it is said, ‚ÄúIt should be seen in that way,‚Äù

original: gal te phyis rnam par dpyad na rmi lam gyi shes pa 'am gzhan dag don dam par phan tshun tha dad pa 'am tha mi dad par 'gyur @30b ba de ltar gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te phyis rnam par dpyad na rmi lam gyi shes pa 'am gzhan dag don dam par phan tshun tha dad pa 'am tha mi dad par 'gyur @30b ba de ltar gzung bar bya'o //
translated: if it is later analyzed, then either the consciousness of a dream or the others would be ultimately either mutually distinct or not distinct.

original: de la gal te brtags na tha dad pa la tshad ma 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par rtogs so //
analyzed: de la gal te brtags na tha dad pa la tshad ma 'ga' yang med pa'i phyir tha mi dad par rtogs so //
translated: If one examines that, since there is no valid cognition at all of difference, one realizes that they are not different.

original: des na 'di la 'gal ba ci yod //
analyzed: des na 'di la 'gal ba ci yod //
translated: So what contradiction is there in this?

original: sngar gyi tha dad par 'dzin pa tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sngar gyi tha dad par 'dzin pa tshad mar mi 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThe former apprehension of difference would not be a valid cognition,‚Äù

original: ma gyur mod skyon ci yod /
analyzed: ma gyur mod skyon ci yod /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúSo what? What is the fault?‚Äù

original: phyogs la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: phyogs la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThere would be no division of directions and so on,‚Äù

original: ma gyur mod da lta nged la chad pa ci yod /
analyzed: ma gyur mod da lta nged la chad pa ci yod /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúSo what? What is the fault for us right now?‚Äù

original: tha dad pa med pa'i sgrub byed tshad ma ma yin pa gang yin pa 'di nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: tha dad pa med pa'i sgrub byed tshad ma ma yin pa gang yin pa 'di nyid do zhe na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúThis very fact that there is no valid cognition of nondifference is the proof,‚Äù

original: de lta na 'o na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na /
translated: we reply, ‚ÄúIn that case,

original: chos can thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa gang yin tshad ma min //üîΩde ltar yin dang de lta bu'i //
analyzed: chos can thun mong ba nyid du rtogs pa gang yin tshad ma min // de ltar yin dang de lta bu'i //
translated: the realization of a common locus would not be a valid cognition.‚ÄùüîΩIf that were so,

original: sgo can phyi rol gzhan yang min //
analyzed: sgo can phyi rol gzhan yang min //
translated: it would not be external, and it would not be like that.

original: rig byed kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa thun mong du chos can rtogs par byed pa tshad ma ma yin du 'gyur te /
analyzed: rig byed kyi mtshan nyid tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa thun mong du chos can rtogs par byed pa tshad ma ma yin du 'gyur te /
translated: The definition of a Vedic injunction would not be a valid cognition, because it is a valid cognition that realizes the common locus of valid and nonvalid cognitions.

original: phyis tshad ma ma yin par bsgrubs pas bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyis tshad ma ma yin par bsgrubs pas bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because later on, it is refuted by the proof that it is not a valid cognition.

original: des na chos can sgrub byed tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas tshad mar sgrub pa tshad ma ma yin pas rig byed tshad mar mi 'grub po //
analyzed: des na chos can sgrub byed tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de'i sgo nas tshad mar sgrub pa tshad ma ma yin pas rig byed tshad mar mi 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, because the proof of the subject is not a valid cognition, the proof of its validity through that is not a valid cognition. Thus, the Vedas are not established as valid cognition.

original: des na bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi tha snyad mtha' dad zhig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bsgrub bya dang sgrub byed kyi tha snyad mtha' dad zhig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the conventions of probandum and probans will be destroyed.

original: 'on te chos can thun mong du 'dzin kyang de 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te chos can thun mong du 'dzin kyang de 'dzin pa tshad ma ma yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Even if one accepts the subject in common, the apprehension of it is not invalidated,

original: de nyid la tshad ma lhag pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //

original: de 'chol ba dang 'bad pa med par 'gyur ba gzhan ga la yod /
analyzed: de 'chol ba dang 'bad pa med par 'gyur ba gzhan ga la yod /
translated: Apart from that, what other confusion is there that is not accomplished through effort?

original: shing la sogs pa'i gnas su mod la mtshe'u la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bad pa med par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: shing la sogs pa'i gnas su mod la mtshe'u la sogs par 'gyur ba'i phyir 'bad pa med par 'gyur ba yin no zhe na /
translated: It is accomplished without effort because a lake and so on can appear in the place of a tree and so on.

original: 'bad pa med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin par bzung 'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pas ni 'bras bu nyid la rgyur gyur pas ni rgyu nyid yin pas /
analyzed: 'bad pa med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba gang yin par bzung 'bras bur gyur pa'i shes pas ni 'bras bu nyid la rgyur gyur pas ni rgyu nyid yin pas /
translated: The so called effortless transformation is the result. The consciousness that becomes the result is the cause.üîΩ

original: 'di 'di las 'gyur ro zhes ga las 'gyur zhing 'di med par 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ltar nges par yang ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di 'di las 'gyur ro zhes ga las 'gyur zhing 'di med par 'di 'byung ngo zhes bya ba de ltar nges par yang ga la 'gyur /
translated: How could it be that this arises from that? How could it be ascertained that this arises in the absence of that?

original: 'di la mngon sum med cing rjes su dpag pa yang med do //
analyzed: 'di la mngon sum med cing rjes su dpag pa yang med do //
translated: There is no perception of this, nor is there inference.

original: 'di 'chol lo zhes bya bar yang 'gas rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di 'chol lo zhes bya bar yang 'gas rig pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not known that this is confused.

original: goms pa'i bye brag gis na rmi lam du 'ang /
analyzed: goms pa'i bye brag gis na rmi lam du 'ang /
translated: Due to the specific habit, even in a dream

original: @32b 'chol ba med pa la sogs pa snang ba dang / de bzhin sad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu yang /
analyzed: @32b 'chol ba med pa la sogs pa snang ba dang / de bzhin sad pa'i gnas skabs dag tu yang /
translated: there is the appearance of non-confusion, etc., and likewise in the state of waking,

original: 'chi ltas stsogs kyis 'chol bar mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'chi ltas stsogs kyis 'chol bar mthong ba nyid do //
translated: confusion is seen due to the fault of the signs of death, etc.

original: de ni 'chi ltas kyi nyes pa nyid kyis yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ni 'chi ltas kyi nyes pa nyid kyis yin no zhe na /
translated: If it is said that this is due to the fault of the signs of death,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: 'chi ltas dang 'chi ltas ma yin pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi ltas dang 'chi ltas ma yin pa dag khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference between the signs of death and the non-signs of death.

original: de la yang rnam par 'byed pa gzhan dgos la /
analyzed: de la yang rnam par 'byed pa gzhan dgos la /
translated: And for that, another differentiation is needed.

original: de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba de lta bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la yang gzhan yin pa'i phyir gang las tha dad par 'gyur ba de lta bu ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And for that, another. Therefore, there is no such thing as a difference that does not come from something else.

original: rang nyid kho nas tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid kho nas tha dad par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But it is different from itself.

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: No, it is not.

original: 'di ni rang gi rang bzhin tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni rang gi rang bzhin tsam gyi mthar thug pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the ultimate of mere self-nature.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i mthar thug pa ni gzhan rig pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i mthar thug pa ni gzhan rig pa ma yin no //
translated: The ultimate of self-nature is not the awareness of something else.

original: rang gi ngo bo tsam rig par ni 'chol pa dang ma 'chol pa mtshungs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo tsam rig par ni 'chol pa dang ma 'chol pa mtshungs so //
translated: The awareness of mere self-nature is the same whether it is correct or incorrect.

original: gal te ring du rjes su 'brel pa dang / 'khrul pa dang brel ba ni ma 'chol ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ring du rjes su 'brel pa dang / 'khrul pa dang brel ba ni ma 'chol ba yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that a correct awareness is one that is connected to something distant and is free from error and confusion, that is not so.

original: mngon sum gyis ring du rjes su 'brel ba mi mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis ring du rjes su 'brel ba mi mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because direct perception does not connect to something distant.

original: des na gzhan rnam par rtog pa lhag mar gyur pa nyid yin na des kyang don rtogs pa ma yin pas de las kyang rnam par mi gnas so //
analyzed: des na gzhan rnam par rtog pa lhag mar gyur pa nyid yin na des kyang don rtogs pa ma yin pas de las kyang rnam par mi gnas so //
translated: Therefore, if the remaining conceptual thoughts are about something else, they do not apprehend the object either, and so they are not correct with regard to that.

original: de yang rang gi ngo bo la mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang rang gi ngo bo la mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is a direct perception of its own nature.

original: dngos po nyams su myong bas skyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi slu ba dang ldan pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po nyams su myong bas skyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni mi slu ba dang ldan pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: But a conceptual cognition that is produced by the experience of an object is not deceptive.

original: 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgang gi tshe dngos po myong ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'brel pa ma bzung ba'i phyir ro // gang gi tshe dngos po myong ba de'i tshe /
translated: No, because the connection is not apprehended.

original: rnam par rtog pa med la /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med la /
translated: When the object is experienced, there is no conceptual cognition.üîΩAnd when the conceptual cognition exists, the experience does not exist. So how can the connection be apprehended at that time?

original: gang gi tshe de yod pa'i tshe nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir 'dir 'brel pa 'dzin pa ga la zhig / rnam par rtog pas so zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe de yod pa'i tshe nyams su myong ba med pa'i phyir 'dir 'brel pa 'dzin pa ga la zhig / rnam par rtog pas so zhe na /
translated: But if you say that the conceptual cognition apprehends the connection,

original: de yang tshad ma ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang tshad ma ma yin no //
translated: that conceptual cognition is not a valid cognition.

original: de yang 'brel pa la ltos pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gzhan dgos pas thug pa med do //
analyzed: de yang 'brel pa la ltos pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa gzhan dgos pas thug pa med do //
translated: And since that conceptual cognition also depends on a connection, it would require another conceptual cognition, and so on, ad infinitum.

original: de lta na 'o na bag chags dang yang 'brel pa ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: de lta na 'o na bag chags dang yang 'brel pa ji ltar 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Well then, how does the conceptual cognition apprehend the connection with the latent impressions?

original: don dam par de dang yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di yang phyogs nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: don dam par de dang yang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di yang phyogs nyid do zhes bstan zin to //
translated: Since it is not ultimately connected with that, this is also a position that has already been taught.üîΩThe Proponents of External Objects

original: phyi rol don smra ngag gis ni //
analyzed: phyi rol don smra ngag gis ni //
translated: say that the object is external.

original: phyi dang rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba'i //üîΩbag chags khas blangs rnam shes su //
analyzed: phyi dang rgyu 'bras zhes bya ba'i // bag chags khas blangs rnam shes su //
translated: The external and the internal, the cause and the effect,üîΩare not accepted by the proponents of consciousness as

original: smra ba rnams kyis ma yin no //
analyzed: smra ba rnams kyis ma yin no //
translated: being produced from habitual propensities.

original: bag chags kyis bskyed pa med kyang 'di rnam par shes pa tsam yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
analyzed: bag chags kyis bskyed pa med kyang 'di rnam par shes pa tsam yin pa'i phyir skyon med do //
translated: Even though they are not produced from habitual propensities, there is no fault, because they are mere consciousness.

original: gal te sad pa'i shes pa bag chags las byung bar rtogs pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sad pa'i shes pa bag chags las byung bar rtogs pa med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that you do not understand how the consciousness of the waking state arises from habitual propensities,

original: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su yang rmi lam du snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'di mtshungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam gyi gnas skabs su yang rmi lam du snang ba ma yin pa'i phyir 'di mtshungs so //
translated: we reply that this is similar to the case of dreams, because the appearances of dreams do not exist in the dream state.

original: @33a * // langs pa la 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @33a * // langs pa la 'gyur ro //
translated: But they exist in the waking state.

original: sad pa'i gnas skabs la ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sad pa'i gnas skabs la ni de lta ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But this is not the case in the waking state.üîΩThis is not a good reply.

original: 'di yang gyi na ste /üîΩ'di ltar / 'di ni bshad zin rmi lam du 'ang //
analyzed: 'di yang gyi na ste / 'di ltar / 'di ni bshad zin rmi lam du 'ang //
translated: For,üîΩwe have already explained that

original: sad par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: sad par rtogs par 'gyur ba yin //
translated: even in dreams, one understands that one is dreaming.

original: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs ni //
analyzed: des na sad pa'i gnas skabs ni //
translated: Therefore, the waking state

original: rmi lam las gzhan mtshan nyid min //
analyzed: rmi lam las gzhan mtshan nyid min //
translated: is not different from dreams in its characteristics.

original: bdag sad do snyam pa ni rmi lam na yang yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: bdag sad do snyam pa ni rmi lam na yang yod pa nyid do //
translated: The thought ‚ÄúI am awake‚Äù exists even in dreams.

original: des na ji ltar sad par snang bas rnam par gzhag sad pa gzhan gyis de yang rmi lam du byed kyi 'di ni gang gis kyang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid don rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
analyzed: des na ji ltar sad par snang bas rnam par gzhag sad pa gzhan gyis de yang rmi lam du byed kyi 'di ni gang gis kyang ma yin pa'i phyir 'di nyid don rnam par gzhag go zhe na /
translated: Therefore, just as the state of waking is established by the appearance of waking, and that state of waking is made into a dream by another waking state, but not by this one, so this very state of waking is established by the appearance of waking, and that state of waking is made into a dream by another waking state, but not by this one.

original: gal te de lta ma yin du chug pa de lta na yang de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir yid ches pa'i gnas ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te de lta ma yin du chug pa de lta na yang de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir yid ches pa'i gnas ma yin no //
translated: Even if that is not so, it is not a reliable basis because it is similar to that.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i du ba me sngon du 'gro ba can du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpog par byed pa nyid ni ma yin gyi //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i dus na yod pa'i du ba me sngon du 'gro ba can du grub pa'i phyir rjes su dpog par byed pa nyid ni ma yin gyi //
translated: It is not that the existence of smoke at the time of inference is established as preceded by fire because of the act of inferring;

original: 'on kyang de'i mtshan nyid yin pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang de'i mtshan nyid yin pa nyid kyis so //
translated: but rather, it is because of its characteristic.

original: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs 'di yang de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du sad pa'i gnas skabs 'di yang de'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir de'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: In the same way, this state of waking is of the nature of that dream because it has that characteristic.

original: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs der sgom pa'i byed pa ma mthong ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te sad pa'i gnas skabs der sgom pa'i byed pa ma mthong ba yin nam /
translated: If the act of dreaming is not seen in that state of waking,

original: ji ltar na rmi lam dang mtshungs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rmi lam dang mtshungs she na /
translated: how is it similar to a dream?

original: de la brjod pa /
analyzed: de la brjod pa /
translated: To this he says:

original: bsgom pa chod par gyur na yang //
analyzed: bsgom pa chod par gyur na yang //
translated: And when the meditation is complete,

original: rab tu snang ba nyid yin te //
analyzed: rab tu snang ba nyid yin te //
translated: it is the appearance itself.

original: dper na rgas pa'i gnas skabs su //
analyzed: dper na rgas pa'i gnas skabs su //
translated: For example, in the state of old age,

original: byis pas mthong ba dmigs pa bzhin //
analyzed: byis pas mthong ba dmigs pa bzhin //
translated: the child is seen as an object.

original: skye ba gzhan sogs mthong ba yang //üîΩ'chi ba'i gnyid kyis log gyur pa //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan sogs mthong ba yang // 'chi ba'i gnyid kyis log gyur pa //
translated: And the seeing of another birth, etc.,

original: skye gzhan skyes pa'i rmi lam du //
analyzed: skye gzhan skyes pa'i rmi lam du //
translated: is like the dream of one who is born in another life.

original: de ltar ci phyir rtogs mi byed //
analyzed: de ltar ci phyir rtogs mi byed //
translated: Why is it not understood in this way?

original: ji ltar mtshan mo gnyid log pa //
analyzed: ji ltar mtshan mo gnyid log pa //
translated: Just as one who is asleep at nightüîΩand one who is asleep in the sleep of death

original: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnyid kyis log pa la yang yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'chi ba'i gnyid kyis log pa la yang yin no //
translated: are the same in being asleep,üîΩbut the one sees dreams and the other does not.

original: gnyid log sad las nyid dang nyin la 'dir //
analyzed: gnyid log sad las nyid dang nyin la 'dir //
translated: Just as one who is asleep and one who is awake are the same in being here in this world,

original: sna tshogs mthong ba de ltar 'di cis min //
analyzed: sna tshogs mthong ba de ltar 'di cis min //
translated: but the one sees various things and the other does not.

original: snang ba ma mthong gyur pa gang yin te /
analyzed: snang ba ma mthong gyur pa gang yin te /
translated: The one who does not see appearances

original: don mthong pa yi rgyu yin pas na mtshungs /
analyzed: don mthong pa yi rgyu yin pas na mtshungs /
translated: is the same in being the cause of seeing objects.

original: ji ltar sngar gyi nyin mo mthong ba mtshan mi rmi lam mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar gyi nyin mo mthong ba mtshan mi rmi lam mthong ba'i rgyu yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the seeing of the previous day is the cause of seeing dreams at night,üîΩso too

original: nyi ma snga ma la mthong ba phyis kyi mtshan mo dang / chod pa'i nyin mo rmi lam mthong ba'i rgyu yin pas 'di ni rmi lam brgyud pa chen po yin no //
analyzed: nyi ma snga ma la mthong ba phyis kyi mtshan mo dang / chod pa'i nyin mo rmi lam mthong ba'i rgyu yin pas 'di ni rmi lam brgyud pa chen po yin no //
translated: The dream of the previous day is the cause of the dream of the following night, and the dream of the previous night is the cause of the dream of the following morning.

original: snga na med pa yang mthong ngo zhe na /
analyzed: snga na med pa yang mthong ngo zhe na /
translated: But you have seen things that did not exist previously!

original: rmi lam du mngon par 'dod pa la yang de lta yin pa'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so //
analyzed: rmi lam du mngon par 'dod pa la yang de lta yin pa'i phyir thams cad mtshungs so //
translated: The same is true of the objects of desire in a dream.üîΩJust as in a dream,

original: ji ltar 'gro 'ong rmi lam du //
analyzed: ji ltar 'gro 'ong rmi lam du //
translated: one sees coming and going,

original: dmigs pa gzhan dang gzhan byed ltar //
analyzed: dmigs pa gzhan dang gzhan byed ltar //
translated: the creation of various objects,

original: sad pa'i gnyid la'ang 'gro ba dang // 'ong ba ci yin @33b phyir mi 'dod //
analyzed: sad pa'i gnyid la'ang 'gro ba dang // 'ong ba ci yin @33b phyir mi 'dod //
translated: so too in the waking state, one does not deny coming and going.

original: tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad med pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But, you say, there is no convention in a dream.üîΩBut, in the same way that the wise make use of inference, why not make use of dreams?

original: mkhas pa rnams rjes su dpag pa 'di nyid kyis tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ci ste mchog / ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad rjes su dpag pa las yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin pas mtshungs so //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams rjes su dpag pa 'di nyid kyis tha snyad byed pa'i phyir ci ste mchog / ji ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu'i tha snyad rjes su dpag pa las yin pa de bzhin du 'di yang yin pas mtshungs so //
translated: The same is true of the convention of cause and effect.

original: skad cig ma nyid la yang tha snyad med pas de med par 'gyur ram ci /
analyzed: skad cig ma nyid la yang tha snyad med pas de med par 'gyur ram ci /
translated: But if it is not a conventional expression, then it is not a moment.

original: de yang med pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: de yang med pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say that it does not exist,

original: 'di ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: we will explain this.

original: gal te gnyid kyis nyams pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong ba'i don ni bden pa ma yin par 'thad do zhe na de gsal ba nyid ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te gnyid kyis nyams pa'i phyir rmi lam du mthong ba'i don ni bden pa ma yin par 'thad do zhe na de gsal ba nyid ma yin nam /
translated: If you say that the object seen in a dream is not true because of the impairment of consciousness by sleep, is it not clear?

original: ji ltar gnyid log pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar gnyid log pa yin /
translated: How is it that one is asleep?

original: dang po gnyid log pa ni nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no //üîΩde nyid snang ba de'i rgyu yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: dang po gnyid log pa ni nye bar sbyor ba ma yin no // de nyid snang ba de'i rgyu yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: One who is asleep is not engaged in the first place.

original: bsgoms pa'i khyad par las snang ba'i khyad par yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i khyad par las snang ba'i khyad par yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say that the cause of the appearance is that very sleep, no, because we see that the appearance is a special case of meditation.

original: dang po gnyid log par mtshungs kyang 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po gnyid log par mtshungs kyang 'ga' zhig gis rnam pa 'ga' zhig ltar rmi lam mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though sleep is the same for everyone, some see certain things in their dreams, while others do not.

original: de med na med pa'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de med na med pa'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If you say that the appearance of the dream is due to the absence of sleep,

original: rgyu mtshan tsam yin la rag mod ;
analyzed: rgyu mtshan tsam yin la rag mod ;
translated: it is merely a reason.

original: de ltar na yang de snang ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de snang ba'i khyad par gyi rgyu ni ma yin no /
translated: Even so, it is not the cause of the special appearance.

original: 'di yang gnyid log pa'i de ma thag pa nyid du snang ba des na rmi lam dang mtshungs pa nyid do //üîΩsad na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang gnyid log pa'i de ma thag pa nyid du snang ba des na rmi lam dang mtshungs pa nyid do // sad na yin no zhe na /
translated: This is also similar to a dream, because the appearance of the dream is immediately after sleep.üîΩIf you say that it is when one awakens,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: snang ba las sad pa ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba las sad pa ma gtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no awakening other than from the appearance.

original: sad do zhes rtogs pa las sad pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: sad do zhes rtogs pa las sad pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that awakening is from the realization that one is asleep, no.

original: rmi lam du yang de ltar rtogs so zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: rmi lam du yang de ltar rtogs so zhes bshad zin to //
translated: Because it has already been explained that one realizes that in a dream as well.

original: de'i phyir rmi lam dang gzhan dag la khyad par med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir rmi lam dang gzhan dag la khyad par med do //
translated: Therefore there is no difference between a dream and other states.

original: des na khyad par mthong ba las dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa tha dad par smra ba gang yin pa de de'i khyad par ma grub pas sun phyung ba yin no //
analyzed: des na khyad par mthong ba las dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang dmigs pa med pa tha dad par smra ba gang yin pa de de'i khyad par ma grub pas sun phyung ba yin no //
translated: Thus, because the difference is not established, the claim that there is a difference between having an object and not having an object is refuted.

original: de ni sad pa'i shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu grub pas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: de ni sad pa'i shes pa dang khyad par med pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu grub pas dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid du mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not established that it has an object because it is established as mistaken since it is not different from the consciousness of the waking state,

original: ma yin te /
analyzed: ma yin te /
translated: This is not so.üîΩ

original: log par snang ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: log par snang ba med par thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: Because it follows that there would be no appearance of error.

original: sad pa'i shes pa nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: sad pa'i shes pa nyid bzhin no //
translated: It is like the consciousness of the waking state.

original: de lta na yang khas blangs pa la gnod do //
analyzed: de lta na yang khas blangs pa la gnod do //
translated: Even so, it contradicts your own assertions.

original: gzhan yang / shes nyid la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
analyzed: gzhan yang / shes nyid la sogs gtan tshigs kyis //
translated: Moreover,

original: gnod byed mngon sum shes pa ni //
analyzed: gnod byed mngon sum shes pa ni //
translated: The consciousness that is the refuter

original: gzhan du bya bar mi nus te //
analyzed: gzhan du bya bar mi nus te //
translated: cannot be made otherwiseüîΩby the reason of being consciousness, etc.

original: rjes dpag mngon sum gnod byed min //üîΩbzlog pa dmigs pa'i rang bzhin mngon sum gyi ngo bo mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gnod par byed pa'i shes pa ni //

analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir pha rol pas brjod pa gzhan yang mi 'thad do // sgra don tsam gyi ngo bo yis //
translated: For that very reason, what is stated by the opponent is also untenable.üîΩHow can one be made to understand

original: ji ltar gzhan dag rtogs byed pa //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag rtogs byed pa //
translated: by the mere nature of the meaning of the word?

original: de lta 'ang khyed la mi 'gyur te//
analyzed: de lta 'ang khyed la mi 'gyur te//
translated: Even so, it will not be for you,

original: brjod bya'i dbye bas mi 'dod phyir //
analyzed: brjod bya'i dbye bas mi 'dod phyir //
translated: because the division of the expressed is not accepted.

original: zhes te / rjod byed dang brjod bya gzhan dag las tha dad par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes te / rjod byed dang brjod bya gzhan dag las tha dad par khas ma blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because we do not accept that the expressed and the expresser are different.

original: rgol ba gang zhig spyi khas ma blangs pas sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin tsam du yang brtag par mi nus pa des ni phas kyi rgol ba chos can la sogs pa'i rtog pa med pas phyir bzlog par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma
analyzed: rgol ba gang zhig spyi khas ma blangs pas sgra'i don gyi rang bzhin tsam du yang brtag par mi nus pa des ni phas kyi rgol ba chos can la sogs pa'i rtog pa med pas phyir bzlog par nus pa ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni ma
translated: But if the opponent does not accept the universal, he cannot even conceive of the mere nature of the object of the word, and he cannot refute the opponent by the absence of the concept of the subject, etc.

original: yin te / rtogs pa zhes khyad par med pa'i sgra'i don tsam /
analyzed: yin te / rtogs pa zhes khyad par med pa'i sgra'i don tsam /
translated: This is not so, because the mere object of the word, which is not distinguished as ‚Äúrealized,‚Äù

original: rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i zhes bya ba'i don gang yin pa /
translated: is the object of consciousness,

original: snang ba zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gang la yod pa de grub pa'i phyir na de ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snang ba zhes bya ba'i rnam grangs gang la yod pa de grub pa'i phyir na de ni ma yin no //
translated: and that which has the synonym ‚Äúappearance‚Äù is established.

original: rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba gang yin pas rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni zla ba gnyis la sogs pa rtogs pa dang gzhan dag la grub pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: rtogs pa nyid ces bya ba gang yin pas rnam pa gcig tu 'dzin pa'i yul gang yin pa de ni zla ba gnyis la sogs pa rtogs pa dang gzhan dag la grub pa nyid yin la /
translated: And that which is called ‚Äúrealization‚Äù is the object of the apprehension of a single aspect, and that is established for others, such as the realization of two moons, etc.

original: de'i de kho na nyid gang yin zhes dpyad par bya ba yin pas de bsgrub bya'i nang du gzhag pa gzhan mtha' dag ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir mi rigs pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i de kho na nyid gang yin zhes dpyad par bya ba yin pas de bsgrub bya'i nang du gzhag pa gzhan mtha' dag ma grub pa yin pa'i phyir mi rigs pa ci yod /
translated: Since it is to be analyzed as to what its reality is, it is not correct to include it among the objects to be established, because all other objects to be established are not established.

original: de la ma grub pa nyid ni phyis bkod nas bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: de la ma grub pa nyid ni phyis bkod nas bzlog par bya'o //
translated: That they are not established will be shown later and refuted.

original: re zhig gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig gzhan dag brjod pa ni /
translated: First, others say:

original: gal te 'di la thams cad du //
analyzed: gal te 'di la thams cad du //
translated: If you establish that all of this

original: dmigs med nyid du sgrub byed na //
analyzed: dmigs med nyid du sgrub byed na //
translated: is without an object,

original: khyad par ma grub par 'gyur te //
analyzed: khyad par ma grub par 'gyur te //
translated: then a distinction is not established,

original: dpe yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and there is no example.

original: rtogs pa thams cad dmigs pa med par sgrub na 'di la dpe gang yod /
analyzed: rtogs pa thams cad dmigs pa med par sgrub na 'di la dpe gang yod /
translated: If you establish that all consciousnesses are without an object, what is your example?

original: 'on te ma sad pa'i shes pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te ma sad pa'i shes pa yin na /
translated: If you say that it is a consciousness of one who is not awake,

original: de @40b ltar na yang dpe ma grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: de @40b ltar na yang dpe ma grub pa nyid de /
translated: then even in that case the example is not established.

original: rmi lam kyi rtogs pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rmi lam kyi rtogs pa yang rnam pa 'ga' zhig dmigs pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is because some of the consciousnesses in a dream have objects,

original: dus de 'am dus gzhan gyi gnas skabs dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus de 'am dus gzhan gyi gnas skabs dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the time of the dream or another time is the object.

original: ci ste dus de'i dmigs pa gzhan med pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa med par brjod pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste dus de'i dmigs pa gzhan med pa nyid yin na ni de'i tshe rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis dmigs pa med par brjod pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin te /
translated: But if the object of that cognition is just the absence of any other object, then at that time, it is established by the statement that it has no object, and so it is established by what is to be established.

original: gzugs kyi shes pa rol sogs pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi shes pa rol sogs pas stong pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the cognition of form is empty of taste, etc.

original: de'i dus sam gzhan gyi dus la sogs pa yang rung ste /
analyzed: de'i dus sam gzhan gyi dus la sogs pa yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is at that time or at another time,

original: gang zhig gang gi tshe /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi tshe /
translated: whatever is cognized at whatever time,

original: ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar de dmigs pa dang bcas par khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dmigs pa de ltar de dmigs pa dang bcas par khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: to that extent it is to be accepted as having an object.

original: de lta yin yang dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na ni ro'i shes pa yang gzugs kyi dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta yin yang dmigs pa med pa nyid yin na ni ro'i shes pa yang gzugs kyi dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: But if it has no object, then the cognition of taste would also be the non-object of form.

original: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no //üîΩ'on te blo la gang zhig gi / rnam yod de dmigs zlog byed na //
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa nyid yin pas grub pa la sgrub pa yin no // 'on te blo la gang zhig gi / rnam yod de dmigs zlog byed na //
translated: But that is accepted, so it is established by what is to be established.üîΩBut if you reject the object,

original: rang gi rnam pa khas blangs phyir //
analyzed: rang gi rnam pa khas blangs phyir //
translated: saying that the existence of the aspect in the mind is the object,

original: de med pa ni 'gal ba yin //
analyzed: de med pa ni 'gal ba yin //
translated: then it is contradictory that it does not exist,üîΩbecause you accept its aspect.

original: rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i cha la don gyi rnam pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i 'dzin pa'i cha la don gyi rnam pa nyid ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the aspect of the object does not exist in the part of consciousness that apprehends.

original: 'o na ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na /
translated: What does exist?

original: shes pa'i rnam pa nyid do zhes khyed kyis khas blangs pa yin pas /
analyzed: shes pa'i rnam pa nyid do zhes khyed kyis khas blangs pa yin pas /
translated: The aspect of consciousness, you admit.

original: de la nga ni shes pa'i gzung ba med par thal bar 'gyur na 'dod pa la yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de la nga ni shes pa'i gzung ba med par thal bar 'gyur na 'dod pa la yang ma yin no //
translated: So, we reply, it follows, absurdly, that you have accepted that consciousness is without an apprehended object, but you do not accept this.

original: de la gzung ba'i bdag nyid dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de la gzung ba'i bdag nyid dmigs par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: For you, the aspect of the object is the object of the mind.

original: ci ste phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: ci ste phyi rol gyi dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: If there is no external object,

original: de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te /
translated: then it is not so.

original: phyi rol dmigs pa med pa la'ang //
analyzed: phyi rol dmigs pa med pa la'ang //
translated: Even if there is no external object,

original: gal te phyi zhes 'dzin med na //
analyzed: gal te phyi zhes 'dzin med na //
translated: if there is no apprehension of external objects,

original: ka la sogs pa blo de med //
analyzed: ka la sogs pa blo de med //
translated: then there would be no cognition of a pot, etc.

original: de ltar na ni grub pa sgrub //
analyzed: de ltar na ni grub pa sgrub //
translated: Thus you are proving what has already been established.

original: gang la blos phyi rol gyi bum pa snyam pa der yang bum pa nyid dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang la blos phyi rol gyi bum pa snyam pa der yang bum pa nyid dmigs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When the mind thinks of an external pot, it is not the pot that is the object of the mind,

original: 'on kyang phyi rol yul nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang phyi rol yul nyid yin no //
translated: but rather the external object itself.

original: de dang gzhi mthun pa'i phyir ni bum pa de ltar rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang gzhi mthun pa'i phyir ni bum pa de ltar rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The pot is cognized in this way because it is the basis of the aspect.

original: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa'i //
analyzed: 'on te ka ba la sogs pa'i //
translated: But if you say that the pillar, etc.

original: ngo bos dmigs pa med brjod na //üîΩnyams su myong ba mthong ba'i phyir //
analyzed: ngo bos dmigs pa med brjod na // nyams su myong ba mthong ba'i phyir //
translated: are not perceived by their own nature,

original: de dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de dang 'gal bar thal bar 'gyur //
translated: then it follows that you contradict your own experience.

original: zla gnyis stsogs la mtshungs she na ;üîΩ/ dbang po phrad pa med phyir der //
analyzed: zla gnyis stsogs la mtshungs she na ; / dbang po phrad pa med phyir der //
translated: If you say that this is similar to the case of the perception of two moons,üîΩwe say that the perception of two moons is not perceived by the sense faculty,

original: dmigs pa med par bdag cag brjod //
analyzed: dmigs pa med par bdag cag brjod //
translated: but not that it is not perceived at all.

original: don rig med pa'i phyir ma yin //üîΩmig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang ma phrad pa blos bzung ba'i phyir /üîΩzla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo dmigs pa med par brjod kyi /
analyzed: don rig med pa'i phyir ma yin // mig la sogs pa'i dbang po dang ma phrad pa blos bzung ba'i phyir / zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo dmigs pa med par brjod kyi /
translated: It is not because the object is not perceived.üîΩThe cognition of two moons, etc. is not perceived by the sense faculty, but it is perceived by the cognition that apprehends it.

original: de dmigs pa med pa nyid ni ma yin no//
analyzed: de dmigs pa med pa nyid ni ma yin no//
translated: Therefore, we say that the perception of two moons, etc. is not perceived by the sense faculty, but not that it is not perceived at all.üîΩIf you say that the cognition of two moons, etc. is not perceived by the sense faculty because it is not accompanied by two sense faculties, as in the case of the cognition of one moon,

original: @41a * // 'di ni ston  zla ba gcig tu rtogs so zhes dbang po de dang gnyis ldan pa med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @41a * // 'di ni ston  zla ba gcig tu rtogs so zhes dbang po de dang gnyis ldan pa med pa'i phyir dmigs pa med pa yin gyi /
translated: then it follows that the cognition of one moon is not perceived by the sense faculty, because it is not accompanied by two sense faculties.

original: thams cad du don med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad du don med pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: But this is not the case.

original: zla ba gcig mthong ba de las bzlog pa dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes dmigs pa med par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: zla ba gcig mthong ba de las bzlog pa dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes dmigs pa med par rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: The non-apprehension of the moon is the cause of the apprehension of the non-existence of the moon.

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni /
translated: This is what is being taught:

original: dbang po don dang 'brel pa dang // ma 'brel pas na thams cad du //
analyzed: dbang po don dang 'brel pa dang // ma 'brel pas na thams cad du //
translated: Because the sense faculties are related to their objects, and because they are not related to other objects,

original: bdag cag myong ba yod pa la //
analyzed: bdag cag myong ba yod pa la //
translated: we experience the existence of the objects.

original: med pa 'dzin par 'jog pa yin //üîΩkhyed la dbang po la sogs pa //
analyzed: med pa 'dzin par 'jog pa yin // khyed la dbang po la sogs pa //
translated: We posit the non-existence of the objects when there is no experience.üîΩBut for you, since the sense faculties and so on do not exist,

original: med phyir 'dzin dang bral bas na //
analyzed: med phyir 'dzin dang bral bas na //
translated: you are devoid of apprehension.

original: dmigs pa nyid ni rgyu med 'gyur //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni rgyu med 'gyur //
translated: Therefore, the object itself would be without cause.

original: dgag pa nyid ni 'thad ma yin //
analyzed: dgag pa nyid ni 'thad ma yin //
translated: And the negation itself would be untenable.

original: rtogs pa dang dmigs pa med do zhes so //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang dmigs pa med do zhes so //
translated: There is no apprehension and no object.

original: 'di ni mi bden pa'i rtogs pa'i dri mas sbags pa'i sems nga rgyal dang bcas par pha rol ston pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu cher rmongs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni mi bden pa'i rtogs pa'i dri mas sbags pa'i sems nga rgyal dang bcas par pha rol ston pa yin pa'i phyir shin tu cher rmongs pa yin no //
translated: This is a very great delusion, because it teaches the other side of the mind defiled by the stain of unreal imagination, together with its pride.

original: 'di ltar / dmigs med sgra yi brjed bya ba //
analyzed: 'di ltar / dmigs med sgra yi brjed bya ba //
translated: Thus:

original: rang gi cha la dmigs pa nyid //
analyzed: rang gi cha la dmigs pa nyid //
translated: The objectless is the object of its own part.

original: gal te tshad mas grub gyur na //
analyzed: gal te tshad mas grub gyur na //
translated: If it were established by valid cognition,

original: sun 'byin ji ltar sun 'byin yin //
analyzed: sun 'byin ji ltar sun 'byin yin //
translated: How can a refutation refute?

original: sgra 'di ni gzhan gyis brtags pa bzung ba la dmigs pa bkag nas rang gi cha la dmigs pa nyid la sbyor ba yin no zhes skabs la sogs pa la rtogs te /
analyzed: sgra 'di ni gzhan gyis brtags pa bzung ba la dmigs pa bkag nas rang gi cha la dmigs pa nyid la sbyor ba yin no zhes skabs la sogs pa la rtogs te /
translated: This sound is applied to the mere object that is the basis of the conception of the imagined other, having refuted the observation of the imagined other.

original: de lta ma yin na sgra las don rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sgra las don rtogs par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the meaning would not be understood from the sound.

original: de la sgra las don 'di la 'jig rten na rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di brtag par mi nus /
analyzed: de la sgra las don 'di la 'jig rten na rtogs pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di brtag par mi nus /
translated: In that case, since the meaning is understood in the world from the sound, how can it be imagined?

original: gal te de la yang rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gzhan las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgra'i don tsam chos can du 'gyur zhes brjod zin ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de la yang rjod par byed pa dang brjod par bya ba gzhan las tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ji ltar sgra'i don tsam chos can du 'gyur zhes brjod zin ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But isn‚Äôt it said that since the object of the sound is not different from the other expressed and expresser, how can the mere object of the sound be the subject?

original: brjod pa ni bden na rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir des ci bya /
analyzed: brjod pa ni bden na rigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir des ci bya /
translated: It is said, but what can be done by that, since it is not reasonable?

original: gang las tha dad par mi 'gyur ba 'di da ltar kho na gnyis med pa'i 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las tha dad par mi 'gyur ba 'di da ltar kho na gnyis med pa'i 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that it is not different from that, but it is not different from that now.

original: 'on kyang rtogs pa ni rtogs pa gzhan dag dang phan tshun yang tha dad pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtogs pa ni rtogs pa gzhan dag dang phan tshun yang tha dad pa nyid do //
translated: But the understanding is different from the other understanding.

original: de la bum pa'i sgra las ni rtogs pa gzhan yin la snam bu'i sgra las kyang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la bum pa'i sgra las ni rtogs pa gzhan yin la snam bu'i sgra las kyang gzhan yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The understanding from the word pot is different from the understanding from the word cloth, and so on.

original: sgras ni sngar bzung ba'i don nyid dran pa'i yul du 'gyur bar byed do //
analyzed: sgras ni sngar bzung ba'i don nyid dran pa'i yul du 'gyur bar byed do //
translated: The word causes the object that was previously apprehended to become the object of memory.

original: de la shes pa gang dag sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa yin par khyed kyi rtogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa de dag dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes gzhan rtogs par byed pa la mi rigs pa ci yod /
analyzed: de la shes pa gang dag sngon po la sogs pa dmigs pa yin par khyed kyi rtogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa de dag dmigs pa med pa yin no zhes gzhan rtogs par byed pa la mi rigs pa ci yod /
translated: What is wrong with making others understand that the consciousnesses that are the objects of your understanding of blue and so on are without objects?

original: gal te 'ga' @41b zhig gis du ba me las byung ba ma yin par rtogs pa de la khyed kyi du ba me las byung ba ma yin par rtogs pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhes de skad brjod par bya ba yin nam ci /
analyzed: gal te 'ga' @41b zhig gis du ba me las byung ba ma yin par rtogs pa de la khyed kyi du ba me las byung ba ma yin par rtogs pa de ni de lta ma yin no zhes de skad brjod par bya ba yin nam ci /
translated: If someone understands that smoke is not an effect of fire, should you say to him, ‚ÄúYour understanding that smoke is not an effect of fire is not like that‚Äù?

original: smra ba po las skyon ci zhig byung /
analyzed: smra ba po las skyon ci zhig byung /
translated: What fault does the speaker have?

original: 'on te me las byung bar sngon mthong bas na de ni rtogs par bya nus kyi 'di la go ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te me las byung bar sngon mthong bas na de ni rtogs par bya nus kyi 'di la go ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But if you say that it is not so, because you have seen fire arise from fuel, then you can understand that, but what is the point of this?

original: 'dir yang rab rib can gyi shes pa dmigs pa med par grub pa nyid de /
analyzed: 'dir yang rab rib can gyi shes pa dmigs pa med par grub pa nyid de /
translated: Here, the cognition of one who has an eye disease is established as having no object,

original: phyi rol med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the external object does not exist.

original: de la yang nam mkha' dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang nam mkha' dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that space is the object,

original: 'o na ji ltar skra shad dmigs pa la nam mkha' dmigs pa yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' dmigs pa la yang gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur te ;
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar skra shad dmigs pa la nam mkha' dmigs pa yin pa de bzhin du nam mkha' dmigs pa la yang gzhan nyid yin par 'gyur te ;
translated: then just as the object of the cognition of falling hair is space, so space itself would be the object of the cognition of falling hair.

original: snang bzhin pa dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang bzhin pa dmigs pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not the case, because space is not the object of the cognition of falling hair.

original: nam mkha'i rtogs pa la snang bzhin pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rtogs pa la snang bzhin pa nyid dmigs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the appearance itself is the object of the cognition of space,

original: 'dir skra'i shes pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir skra'i shes pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then the same would apply to the cognition of falling hair.

original: thams cad la phyin ci log tu snang ba dang / dran pa brjod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs par brtag pa'am /
analyzed: thams cad la phyin ci log tu snang ba dang / dran pa brjod pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa la sogs par brtag pa'am /
translated: It is not the case that everything appears erroneously, that memory is expressed, or that one transcends the world, and so on.

original: 'ga' la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni nges ba yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' la yang ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni nges ba yin no //
translated: This is certain.

original: ci ste dmigs pa dang bcas pa zla ba gcig gi shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa ldan pas zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa dmigs pa med do zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
analyzed: ci ste dmigs pa dang bcas pa zla ba gcig gi shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa ldan pas zla ba gnyis kyi shes pa dmigs pa med do zhes bya bar rigs kyi /
translated: But if the consciousness of one month is associated with an object, then it is logical to say that the consciousness of two months is devoid of an object.

original: zla ba gcig gi shes pa la ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: zla ba gcig gi shes pa la ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But how can the consciousness of one month be so?

original: de yang de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin to //
analyzed: de yang de'i rang bzhin can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod zin to //
translated: We have already explained that it is so because it has the same nature.

original: gnod par byas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gnod par byas pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is because it is impaired,

original: de la yang gnod par byas so zhes bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la yang gnod par byas so zhes bstan zin to //
translated: we have already shown that it is impaired.

original: mi snang ba yang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: mi snang ba yang dmigs pa ma yin no zhes bshad par bya'o //

original: sngon po la sogs pa shes pa nyid yin par yang ston par 'gyur ro //
